00033 #include <stdint.h>
00034 #include "em_device.h"
00035 
00036 /*******************************************************************************
00037  ******************************   DEFINES   ************************************
00038  ******************************************************************************/
00039 
00041 #define EFM32_LFRCO_FREQ  (32768UL)
00042 #define EFM32_ULFRCO_FREQ (1000UL)
00043 
00044 /*******************************************************************************
00045  **************************   LOCAL VARIABLES   ********************************
00046  ******************************************************************************/
00047 
00048 /* System oscillator frequencies. These frequencies are normally constant */
00049 /* for a target, but they are made configurable in order to allow run-time */
00050 /* handling of different boards. The crystal oscillator clocks can be set */
00051 /* compile time to a non-default value by defining respective EFM32_nFXO_FREQ */
00052 /* values according to board design. By defining the EFM32_nFXO_FREQ to 0, */
00053 /* one indicates that the oscillator is not present, in order to save some */
00054 /* SW footprint. */
00055 
00056 #ifndef EFM32_HFXO_FREQ
00057 #define EFM32_HFXO_FREQ (24000000UL)
00058 #endif
00059 
00060 #define EFM32_HFRCO_MAX_FREQ    (21000000UL)
00061 
00062 /* Do not define variable if HF crystal oscillator not present */
00063 #if (EFM32_HFXO_FREQ > 0)
00064 
00066 static uint32_t SystemHFXOClock = EFM32_HFXO_FREQ;
00068 #endif
00069 
00070 #ifndef EFM32_LFXO_FREQ
00071 #define EFM32_LFXO_FREQ (EFM32_LFRCO_FREQ)
00072 #endif
00073 
00074 /* Do not define variable if LF crystal oscillator not present */
00075 #if (EFM32_LFXO_FREQ > 0)
00076 
00078 static uint32_t SystemLFXOClock = EFM32_LFXO_FREQ;
00080 #endif
00081 
00082 /*******************************************************************************
00083  **************************   GLOBAL VARIABLES   *******************************
00084  ******************************************************************************/
00085 
00093 uint32_t SystemCoreClock;
00094 
00095 /*******************************************************************************
00096  **************************   GLOBAL FUNCTIONS   *******************************
00097  ******************************************************************************/
00098 
00099 /***************************************************************************/
00116 uint32_t SystemCoreClockGet(void)
00117 {
00118   uint32_t ret;
00119 
00120   ret = SystemHFClockGet();
00121   ret >>= (CMU->HFCORECLKDIV & _CMU_HFCORECLKDIV_HFCORECLKDIV_MASK) >>
00122           _CMU_HFCORECLKDIV_HFCORECLKDIV_SHIFT;
00123 
00124   /* Keep CMSIS variable up-to-date just in case */
00125   SystemCoreClock = ret;
00126 
00127   return ret;
00128 }
00129 
00130 
00131 /***************************************************************************/
00141 uint32_t SystemMaxCoreClockGet(void)
00142 {
00143   return (EFM32_HFRCO_MAX_FREQ > EFM32_HFXO_FREQ ? \
00144           EFM32_HFRCO_MAX_FREQ : EFM32_HFXO_FREQ);
00145 }
00146 
00147 
00148 /***************************************************************************/
00158 uint32_t SystemHFClockGet(void)
00159 {
00160   uint32_t ret;
00161 
00162   switch (CMU->STATUS & (CMU_STATUS_HFRCOSEL | CMU_STATUS_HFXOSEL |
00163                          CMU_STATUS_LFRCOSEL | CMU_STATUS_LFXOSEL))
00164   {
00165     case CMU_STATUS_LFXOSEL:
00166 #if (EFM32_LFXO_FREQ > 0)
00167       ret = SystemLFXOClock;
00168 #else
00169       /* We should not get here, since core should not be clocked. May */
00170       /* be caused by a misconfiguration though. */
00171       ret = 0;
00172 #endif
00173       break;
00174 
00175     case CMU_STATUS_LFRCOSEL:
00176       ret = EFM32_LFRCO_FREQ;
00177       break;
00178 
00179     case CMU_STATUS_HFXOSEL:
00180 #if (EFM32_HFXO_FREQ > 0)
00181       ret = SystemHFXOClock;
00182 #else
00183       /* We should not get here, since core should not be clocked. May */
00184       /* be caused by a misconfiguration though. */
00185       ret = 0;
00186 #endif
00187       break;
00188 
00189     default: /* CMU_STATUS_HFRCOSEL */
00190       switch (CMU->HFRCOCTRL & _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_MASK)
00191       {
00192       case CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_21MHZ:
00193         ret = 21000000;
00194         break;
00195 
00196       case CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_14MHZ:
00197         ret = 14000000;
00198         break;
00199 
00200       case CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_11MHZ:
00201         ret = 11000000;
00202         break;
00203 
00204       case CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_7MHZ:
00205         ret = 6600000;
00206         break;
00207 
00208       case CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_1MHZ:
00209         ret = 1200000;
00210         break;
00211 
00212       default:
00213         ret = 0;
00214         break;
00215       }
00216       break;
00217   }
00218 
00219   return ret;
00220 }
00221 
00222 
00223 /**************************************************************************/
00233 uint32_t SystemHFXOClockGet(void)
00234 {
00235   /* External crystal oscillator present? */
00236 #if (EFM32_HFXO_FREQ > 0)
00237   return SystemHFXOClock;
00238 #else
00239   return 0;
00240 #endif
00241 }
00242 
00243 
00244 /**************************************************************************/
00259 void SystemHFXOClockSet(uint32_t freq)
00260 {
00261   /* External crystal oscillator present? */
00262 #if (EFM32_HFXO_FREQ > 0)
00263   SystemHFXOClock = freq;
00264 
00265   /* Update core clock frequency if HFXO is used to clock core */
00266   if (CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_HFXOSEL)
00267   {
00268     /* The function will update the global variable */
00269     SystemCoreClockGet();
00270   }
00271 #else
00272   (void)freq; /* Unused parameter */
00273 #endif
00274 }
00275

00277 /**************************************************************************/
00289 void SystemInit(void)
00290 {
00291 }
00292 
00293 
00294 /**************************************************************************/
00304 uint32_t SystemLFRCOClockGet(void)
00305 {
00306   /* Currently we assume that this frequency is properly tuned during */
00307   /* manufacturing and is not changed after reset. If future requirements */
00308   /* for re-tuning by user, we can add support for that. */
00309   return EFM32_LFRCO_FREQ;
00310 }
00311 
00312 
00313 /**************************************************************************/
00323 uint32_t SystemULFRCOClockGet(void)
00324 {
00325   /* The ULFRCO frequency is not tuned, and can be very inaccurate */
00326   return EFM32_ULFRCO_FREQ;
00327 }
00328 
00329 
00330 /**************************************************************************/
00340 uint32_t SystemLFXOClockGet(void)
00341 {
00342   /* External crystal oscillator present? */
00343 #if (EFM32_LFXO_FREQ > 0)
00344   return SystemLFXOClock;
00345 #else
00346   return 0;
00347 #endif
00348 }
00349 
00350 
00351 /**************************************************************************/
00366 void SystemLFXOClockSet(uint32_t freq)
00367 {
00368   /* External crystal oscillator present? */
00369 #if (EFM32_LFXO_FREQ > 0)
00370   SystemLFXOClock = freq;
00371 
00372   /* Update core clock frequency if LFXO is used to clock core */
00373   if (CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_LFXOSEL)
00374   {
00375     /* The function will update the global variable */
00376     SystemCoreClockGet();
00377   }
00378 #else
00379   (void)freq; /* Unused parameter */
00380 #endif
00381 }
